description: Police regularly review the impact of alcohol on levels of violent crime in York city centre.
title: Alcohol fuels more than half of York city centre crimes
title_page: Alcohol fuels more than half of York city centre crimes - police - BBC News
maintext:
More than half of violent crimes reported in York city centre are fuelled by alcohol, according to a police report.
Councillors will be told that 1,005 violent crimes were recorded in the area between April 2023 and March 2024.
Most were reported between 14:00 and 18:00, with August being the month when the highest number of incidents were recorded.
In a report, council officers said the level of crimes was regularly reviewed as "evidence shows that the cumulative impact of the number and concentration of licensed premises in this area continues to adversely affect residents, visitors and other businesses".
